   20: 
   21: -module(dump_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([signal_abort/1, exiting_dump/1, free_dump/1,
   28:          heart_dump/1, heart_no_dump/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([load/1]).
   31: 
   32: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   33: 
   34: suite() ->
   35:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   36:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   37: 
   38: all() ->
   39:     [signal_abort, exiting_dump, free_dump, heart_dump, heart_no_dump].
   40: 
   41: init_per_testcase(signal_abort, Config) ->
   42:     SO = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
   43:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   44:     Dump = erts_debug:get_internal_state(scheduler_dump),
   45:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   46:     if SO < 3 ->
   47:             {skip, "not enough schedulers"};
   48:        not Dump ->
   49:             {skip, "the platform does not support scheduler dump"};
   50:        Dump ->
   51:             Config
   52:     end;
   53: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: 
   57: end_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   58:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   59: 
   60: %%%
   61: %%% The test cases -------------------------------------------------------------
   62: %%%
   63: 
   64: %% Test that a snapshot is taken of other schedulers using a signal
   65: %% when a crash dump is generated.
   66: signal_abort(Config) ->
   67: 
   68:     Dump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),"signal_abort.dump"),
   69: 
   70:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   71: 
   72:     false = rpc:call(Node, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
   73:                      [available_internal_state, true]),
   74: 
   75:     Iter = lists:seq(2, 3),
   76: 
   77:     spawn_opt(Node,
   78:               fun() ->
   79:                       os:putenv("ERL_CRASH_DUMP", Dump),
   80:                       code:ensure_loaded(timer),
   81: 
   82:                       %% We spread the load on all schedulers except scheduler 1
   83:                       [spawn_opt(?MODULE, load, [self()], [{scheduler, I}])
   84:                        || I <- Iter],
   85: 
   86:                       %% Make sure that each process is started
   87:                       [receive ok -> ok end || _ <- Iter],
   88:                       timer:sleep(500),
   89:                       erlang:halt("dump")
   90:               end,
   91:               [{scheduler,1},{priority,high}, monitor]),
   92:     receive
   93:         M -> ct:pal("~p",[M])
   94:     end,
   95: 
   96:     {ok, Bin} = get_dump_when_done(Dump),
   97: 
   98:     {match, Matches} = re:run(Bin,"Current Process: <",[global]),
   99: 
  100:     ct:log("Found ~p",[Matches]),
  101: 
  102:     true = length(Matches) > 1,
  103: 
  104:     file:delete(Dump),
  105: 
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: load(Parent) ->
  109:     Parent ! ok,
  110:     load().
  111: load() ->
  112:     %% We generate load by sleeping
  113:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(sleep, 10),
  114:     load().
  115: 
  116: 
  117: %% Test that crash dumping when a process is in the state EXITING works
  118: exiting_dump(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  119:     Dump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),"signal_abort.dump"),
  120: 
  121:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  122: 
  123:     Self = self(),
  124: 
  125:     Pid = spawn_link(Node,
  126:                      fun() ->
  127:                              [begin
  128:                                   T = ets:new(hej,[]),
  129:                                   [ets:insert(T,{I,I}) || I <- lists:seq(1,1000)]
  130:                               end || _ <- lists:seq(1,1000)],
  131:                              Self ! ready,
  132:                              receive {terminate, Pid} -> Pid ! ok end
  133:                      end),
  134: 
  135:     true = rpc:call(Node, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",Dump]),
  136: 
  137:     receive ready -> unlink(Pid), Pid ! {terminate, self()} end,
  138:     receive ok -> ok end,
  139: 
  140:     rpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, ["dump"]),
  141: 
  142:     {ok, Bin} = get_dump_when_done(Dump),
  143: 
  144:     {match, Matches} = re:run(Bin,"^State: Exiting", [global, multiline]),
  145: 
  146:     ct:log("Found ~p",[Matches]),
  147: 
  148:     true = length(Matches) == 1,
  149: 
  150:     file:delete(Dump),
  151: 
  152:     ok.
  153: 
  154: %% Test that crash dumping when a process is in the state FREE works
  155: free_dump(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  156:     Dump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),"signal_abort.dump"),
  157: 
  158:     {ok, _PeerA, NodeA} = ?CT_PEER(),
  159:     {ok, PeerB, NodeB} = ?CT_PEER(),
  160: 
  161:     Self = self(),
  162: 
  163:     PidA = spawn_link(
  164:              NodeA,
  165:              fun() ->
  166:                      Self ! ready,
  167:                      Reason = lists:duplicate(1000000,100),
  168:                      receive
  169:                          ok ->
  170:                              spawn(fun() ->
  171:                                            erlang:system_monitor(self(), [busy_dist_port]),
  172:                                            timer:sleep(5),
  173:                                            receive
  174:                                                M ->
  175:                                                    io:format("~p",[M])
  176: %% We may want to add this timeout here in-case no busy condition is triggered
  177: %%                                           after 60 * 1000 ->
  178: %%                                                   io:format("Timeout")
  179:                                            end,
  180:                                            erlang:halt("dump")
  181:                                    end),
  182:                              exit(Reason)
  183:                      end
  184:              end),
  185: 
  186:     PidB = spawn_link(NodeB,
  187:                       fun() ->
  188:                               [erlang:monitor(process, PidA) || _ <- lists:seq(1,10000)],
  189:                               Self ! done,
  190:                               receive _ -> ok end
  191:                       end),
  192: 
  193:     receive done -> ok end,
  194:     true = rpc:call(NodeA, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",Dump]),
  195:     %% Make the node busy towards NodeB for 10 seconds.
  196:     BusyPid = rpc:call(NodeA, distribution_SUITE, make_busy, [NodeB,10000]),
  197:     ct:pal("~p",[BusyPid]),
  198: 
  199:     receive ready -> unlink(PidA), PidA ! ok end,
  200: 
  201:     {ok, Bin} = get_dump_when_done(Dump),
  202: 
  203:     {match, Matches} = re:run(Bin,"^State: Non Existing", [global, multiline]),
  204: 
  205:     ct:log("Found ~p",[Matches]),
  206: 
  207:     true = length(Matches) == 1,
  208: 
  209:     file:delete(Dump),
  210: 
  211:     unlink(PidB),
  212: 
  213:     peer:stop(PeerB),
  214: 
  215:     ok.
  216: 
  217: %% Test that crash dumping works when heart is used
  218: heart_dump(Config) ->
  219:     Dump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),"heart.dump"),
  220:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-heart"] }),
  221:     true = rpc:call(Node, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",Dump]),
  222:     true = rpc:call(Node, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS","10"]),
  223:     rpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, ["dump"]),
  224:     {ok, _Bin} = get_dump_when_done(Dump),
  225:     ok.
  226: 
  227: %% Test that there is no crash dump if heart is used and DUMP_SECONDS is not set
  228: heart_no_dump(Config) ->
  229:     Dump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),"heart_no.dump"),
  230:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-heart"] }),
  231:     true = rpc:call(Node, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",Dump]),
  232:     true = rpc:call(Node, os, unsetenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS"]),
  233:     rpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, ["dump"]),
  234:     timer:sleep(1000),
  235:     {error, enoent} = file:read_file_info(Dump),
  236:     ok.
  237: 
  238: get_dump_when_done(Dump) ->
  239:     case file:read_file_info(Dump) of
  240:         {ok, #file_info{ size = Sz }} ->
  241:             get_dump_when_done(Dump, Sz);
  242:         {error, enoent} ->
  243:             timer:sleep(1000),
  244:             get_dump_when_done(Dump)
  245:     end.
  246: 
  247: get_dump_when_done(Dump, Sz) ->
  248:     timer:sleep(1000),
  249:     case file:read_file_info(Dump) of
  250:         {ok, #file_info{ size = Sz }} when Sz > 1000 ->
  251:             {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Dump),
  252:             ct:log("~s",[Bin]),
  253:             {ok, Bin};
  254:         {ok, #file_info{ size = NewSz }} ->
  255:             get_dump_when_done(Dump, NewSz)
  256:     end.
